name: restic
description: Restic is a secure, fast, self-hosted backup client. It supports encryption, deduplication, multiple backends, and CLI operations for efficient backup and restore workflows.
features: Encrypted backups: Protect data with AES-256 encryption before uploading to storage.
Deduplication: Save storage space by identifying and storing only unique data blocks.
Multiple backends: Back up to local disks, SFTP, S3, Azure, Google Cloud, and more.
Incremental backups: Transfer only changed data to minimize backup time and bandwidth.
Snapshot management: Create point-in-time snapshots and restore to any previous state.
Compression: Reduce backup size with built-in compression algorithms.
Verification: Check backup integrity with cryptographic hashes to detect corruption.
Selective restore: Recover individual files or directories without restoring entire backups.
Cross-platform: Run on Linux, macOS, Windows, and BSD with consistent functionality.
Retention policies: Automatically remove old snapshots based on age or count limits.
Mount support: Access backup snapshots as read-only filesystems using FUSE.
CLI interface: Automate backup workflows with scriptable command-line operations.
